summary: Memory leak caused by accumulation of OperatorSubscriber objects that are not properly cleaned up in the temporal TypeScript worker, leading to out-of-memory container kills. Issue was resolved in an earlier SDK version, though similar symptoms may occur in user code with incorrect AsyncLocalStorage cleanup.
userImpact: Worker containers are killed due to out-of-memory errors caused by accumulating OperatorSubscriber objects that are never cleaned up.
rootCause: OperatorSubscriber objects created on the temporal-worker side were not being properly cleaned up, causing memory accumulation over time.
resolutionDetails: The actual SDK bug from May 2022 was resolved in an earlier version. Similar symptoms reported later were traced to incorrect cleanup of AsyncLocalStorage in user code, leading to issue #1432.
keyQuote: a lot of 'OperatorSubscriber' objects create on temporal-worker side, but it never clean, and it make memory leak problem
